intro: Lesquerella alpina var. intermedia, commonly known as the alpine lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine pubescence. Lesquerella alpina var. intermedia is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
